meico.audio

Class AudioPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.audio.AudioPlayer

  • public class AudioPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides audio playback functionality.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javax.sound.sampled.Clip audioClip

      private javax.sound.sampled.LineListener playbackListener 
      private int playbackPositionInFrames

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.sound.sampled.Clip getAudioClip()
      a getter for the audio clip
      int getFrameLength()
      returns the frame count of the audio clip or 0 if none is loaded
      long getFramePosition()
      obtains the current playback position in micoroseconds
      long getMicrosecondLength()
      returns the length of the audio clip in microseconds or 0 if none is loaded
      long getMicrosecondPosition()
      obtains the current playback position in micoroseconds
      double getRelativePosition()
      obtains the current playback position, expressed as relative value between 0.0 (beginning) and 1.0 (end)
      boolean isPlaying()
      is the audioClip playing?
      void pause()
      pause playback, i.e. keep audio data buffered (in audioClip) and store the playback position
      void play()
      Given that the AudioPlayer has already loaded audio data (i.e. an audio clip), this can be used to start playback.
      void play(Audio audio)
      start playing back the given audio data
      void play(Audio audio, double relativePlaybackPosition)
      start playing back the given audio data
      void play(byte[] pcmAudio, javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format, double relativePlaybackPosition)
      start playing back the given audio data
      void play(double relativePlaybackPosition)
      Given that the AudioPlayer has already loaded audio data (i.e. an audio clip), this can be used to start playback.
      void play(int playbackPositionInFrames)
      Given that the AudioPlayer has already loaded audio data (i.e. an audio clip), this can be used to start playback.
      boolean setAudioData(Audio audio)
      a setter for the audio clip, can be used to load audio data without playing it back
      boolean setAudioData(byte[] pcmAudio, javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format)
      a setter for the audio clip, can be used to load audio data without playing it back
      boolean setAudioData(javax.sound.sampled.Clip audioClip)
      a setter for the audio clip, can be used to load audio data without playing it back
      void setFramePosition(int frames)
      a setter for the playback position
      void setMicrosecondPosition(long microseconds)
      a setter for the playback position
      void setRelativePlaybackPosition(double relativePosition)
      a setter for the playback position
      void stop()
      stop audio playback, audio data is deleted from the buffer and has to be reloaded

        Returns:
        true for success, else false

      • play

        public void play()
        Given that the AudioPlayer has already loaded audio data (i.e. an audio clip), this can be used to start playback. The playback will start at the beginning or at a specified position (via setPlaybackPosition() or pause()).

      • play

        public void play(int playbackPositionInFrames)
        Given that the AudioPlayer has already loaded audio data (i.e. an audio clip), this can be used to start playback. The playback will start at the beginning or at a specified position.
        Parameters:
        playbackPositionInFrames -

      • play

        public void play(double relativePlaybackPosition)
        Given that the AudioPlayer has already loaded audio data (i.e. an audio clip), this can be used to start playback. The playback will start at the beginning or at a specified position.
        Parameters:
        relativePlaybackPosition -

      • play

        public void play(Audio audio)
        start playing back the given audio data
        Parameters:

      • play

        public void play(Audio audio,
                 double relativePlaybackPosition)
        start playing back the given audio data
        Parameters:
        audio -
        relativePlaybackPosition - a relative playback position in [0.0-1.0) to start

      • play

        public void play(byte[] pcmAudio,
                 javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat format,
                 double relativePlaybackPosition)
        start playing back the given audio data
        Parameters:
        pcmAudio - PCM encoded audio data in a byte array
        format - audio format information
        relativePlaybackPosition - a relative playback position in [0.0-1.0) to start

      • pause

        public void pause()
        pause playback, i.e. keep audio data buffered (in audioClip) and store the playback position

      • stop

        public void stop()
        stop audio playback, audio data is deleted from the buffer and has to be reloaded
